fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33271].
  {panel}

Currently the [Configuring JIRA Options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options] page lists the following for External User Management:

{quote}
When turned ON, you will no longer be able to create, edit or delete users/groups from within JIRA (or via email or import); but you can still assign users/groups to project roles, and create/edit/delete user properties. Additionally, JIRA will not display options for users to change their password, or edit their profile.
Generally you would only turn this ON if you are managing all your users from outside JIRA (e.g. using Crowd, Microsoft Active Directory or another LDAP directory).
Default: OFF
{quote}

However through the GUI we can see that this has changed (when editing those settings):

{quote}
Indicates that you are using user management from outside JIRA. JIRA will not display options for users to change their password, or edit their profile.
Note: With the 'authentication only' LDAP provider, this should be left off, as accounts are stored locally.
{quote}

As of JRA-27280 this functionality has changed, as from [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-27280?focusedCommentId=334737&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-334737].

Can you please update the following pages to reflect this:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA050/Configuring+JIRA+Options
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Configuring+JIRA+Options
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA052/Configuring+JIRA+Options
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options

Thanks!
fields.summary: Update Configuring JIRA Options docs for External User Management

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33268].
  {panel}

When attempting to Sync a GitHub respository with the DVCS connector the following stacktrace was seen:
{noformat}
com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlDataTruncation: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'MESSAGE' at row 1
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
	- name:MySQL
	- version:5.5.29-0ubuntu1
	- minor version:5
	- major version:5
Driver:
	- name:MySQL Connector Java
	- version:mysql-connector-java-5.1.25 ( Revision: ${bzr.revision-id} )

com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlDataTruncation: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'MESSAGE' at row 1
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.EntityManagedActiveObjects.create(EntityManagedActiveObjects.java:105)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.DelegatingActiveObjects.create(DelegatingActiveObjects.java:61)
...
Caused by: com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlDataTruncation: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'MESSAGE' at row 1
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:4185)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:4119)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sendCommand(MysqlIO.java:2570)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sqlQueryDirect(MysqlIO.java:2731)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.execSQL(ConnectionImpl.java:2815)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeInternal(PreparedStatement.java:2155)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:2458)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:2375)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:2359)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:105)
{noformat}
* Strict Mode did not do anything as well.  
* Ultimately changing the datatype to 'LONGTEXT' solved this issue. 


{panel:title=Workaround| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#a7c4e2 | bgColor=#E7F4FA}
The problem here was that the length of the message in the repository was beyond what the datatype "text" could receive (64k), so making this bigger solved the issue.
{code}
ALTER TABLE 'AO_E8B6CC_CHANGESET_MAPPING' MODIFY MESSAGE LONGTEXT;
{code}


{panel}

Can we make this error more descriptive or possibly output the value that is too long in the logs, or even the frontend for the customer to easily understand?
fields.summary: DVCS Data Truncation Error Should be More Descriptive

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33263].
  {panel}

It will be great if we can allow end users to create issues by importing from csv/excel or other mechanism. Currently in JIRA, the Importers Plugin is available for administrators only. 

h5. Here are current situation for this feature:
* As we can see that you must Log in to JIRA as a user with the JIRA Administrators global permission. 
* The import tool is located under {{Administration > System > Import & Export > External System Import > Import}}, you only can access this page by login as administrator 
* During the importing, user can 'Create New Project' in your JIRA. It will be difficult for you to organize your system if any user can create projects.

h5. What we can change:
* Make the Importer plugin as a accessible feature on the JIRA UI for end users.
* During the importing, restrict end user on the Project Permissions level to be able/not able to 'Create New Project' in JIRA
fields.summary: Allow end users to create issues by importing from CSV or other importers

fields.description:
{{whereismycf.inspection.securitylevel.problem.nopermission}} has a lone single quote character that has not been escaped. 

This will cause the following on placeholder to not be substituted with the appropiate parameters, rendering the message incorrectly. Additionally, this makes it impossible to translate the key to any language in TAC at the moment.
fields.summary: Unescaped single quote in the Where is my CF plugin

fields.description:
After the plug-in (service desk) has been informed that is has been started (PluginEnabledEvent) we do a i18n lookup which fails.

Tested with 6.0-m09 and 6.0-rc1. Only fails during first start with an empty database. eg when you have the database configured BUT nothing in the tables

After that it works. This issue does not exist in JIRA 5.1.

In service desk it leads to custom fields being created with ugly i18n key in them because we cant get access to i18n keys in the plugin started event.

Brad created a test plugin that demonstrates this bug

https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/jira-test-plugins/src/8582d9db83cb/start-order-plugin?at=master

This will print information during the start phases of a plugin. It confirms that during the state where the database has been initialised (and the plugin system inherently restarted) then the i18n key of a plugin are not available to itself.

I suspect we are not getting the "cache clearing" events we think inside the I18nHelper.Factory code.''

The upshot of this bug is that plugins can use i18n keys inside "plugin enabled event" processing to do anything like setup data.
fields.summary: Plugins cant get access to their i18n keys during plugin enablement event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33255].
  {panel}

Currently users have to go through a fairly laborious set of steps as per [Running JIRA over SSL or HTTPS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS] to configure JIRA. If we were able to automate the creation of a JKS and generation of a CSR it would make this job a whole lot easier.

Can you please add a feature to the JIRA Config Tool that would:

# Create a new JKS and provide a CSR.
# Prompt the user to have it signed.
# Let the user enter the cert and provide the CA certs.
# Configure Tomcat to use that keystore and enable SSL.

Step 4 already exists, it would just need to be hooked into step 1-3.

If we can also handle conversion of certificates that would be ideal. For example, a user can import a PEM public cert and a PKCS12 private key into a PrivateKeyEntry that would be awesome. Maybe we could even put in some checks to ensure the cert chain is complete? I'm not entirely sure about how limitations here,.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Enhance the JIRA Config Tool to automate SSL Generation

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33247].
  {panel}

Setup requires more than one user that has the same email address. 
One user has access to the issue and one user does not belong to a group that has permission to an issue. 
Must have an incoming email handler setup to add comments to an issue via an email reply. 
Notification event occurs on issue assignment
Create an issue and assign to user 1 (the one who has permission to the issue)
User 1 receives an email
User 1 replies to the email
Comment not logged because it is interpreted to be associated with user 2

There isn't a requirement that email addresses be unique.  May need to either evaluate any user that meets the email address, update the documentation to be clear, or not evaluate permissions. 

Minor issue.
fields.summary: Comments via email do not work correctly when more than one user has the same email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33244].
  {panel}

I really would love to have endless nested tasks.

Currently, we have two types of issue types:
 * Standard Issue Type
 ** may have Sub-Task Issue Type as child
 * Sub-Task Issue Type
 ** No child allowed

Therefore, we can't have a nested task structure like the following:
 * Databases
 ** Database-structure for user (login and profile information)
 * The Frontend of my application
 ** Login-Mask
 *** Servlet for the database connection and credential validation
 *** Graphical User Interface taking username and password
 ** Registration
 *** Servlet [...]
 * Application Server

and so on.
Therefore, we could say: We cant start developing the Servlet for the Login Mask until we haven't finished developing the Application Server.

It won't be much work to implement and would make it possible to split big tasks or components into smaller and smaller features. In that way, a very agile project planning is possible, because you have a way better overview and can manage groups of tasks.
fields.summary: Allowing nested tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33234].
  {panel}

If a user is to move an issue from JIRA A to JIRA B, when in JIRA B, the Set Issue Security permission is not configured or the user being logged in JIRA B do not have the correct permission will face an error. Weirdly, if there is *no* Set Issue Security permission configured in JIRA A (while the issue has a issue security level), the remote copy works fine.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up JIRA A and JIRA B with JIRA to JIRA Issue Copy
# Set up Application Link between JIRA A and JIRA B
# Create Project AA in JIRA A with Issue Security Level enable
#- Create the Issue Security Level for Project Roles(Developers)
#- Gives the user permission to Set Issue Security in JIRA A
# Create Project BB in JIRA B without any Issue Security Level
#- Use the Default Permission Scheme for Project BB
# Create an issue in Project AA with a security level
# Remote copy the issue from Project AA to Project BB and will encounter the following error
!RIC_nosecurity_both.PNG!

h4. Additional Notes
* It has been tested to Remote Copy between JIRA 5.2.10 and JIRA 5.2.11
* It has been tested with JIRA to JIRA Issue Copy 3.0 and 3.1
* The same error will occur when both instance has not set issue security permission configured
* The error does not occur if JIRA A do not has Set issue security permission configured

h4. Expected behaviour
What is the expected behaviour? A customer asked previously, why is the error occured when trying to copy an issue to a vanilla instance with no Security Level scheme configured. The problem seems to be with the permission for _Set Issue Security_. If this is indeed the expected behaviour, the error thrown should clearly state that the user in Project BB do not has the correct permission.
fields.summary: Remote Issue Copy - Set Issue Security permission error

fields.description: Our installation is running JIRA 5.0.7.  After a recent upgrade of the Tempo Plugin from 7.4.1 to 7.6.0.1 I observe a change in the behavior of the JIRA keyboard shortcuts:  When viewing a list of issues using the issue navigator, then viewing a selected  issue from the list, the j and k keys do not function as expected:  striking j does not present the next issue in the list, and striking k does not present the previous issue in the list. I suspect this may be related to the upgrade of tempo for the following reasons:  1)  I did not observe the defect described above until after Tempo was upgraded to 7.6.0.1 2); when I attempt the same operation on our test system (5.0.7 with Tempo 7.4.1) the j & k shortcut keys behave as expected; and 3) when I disable the Tempo 7.6.0.1 then retry the operation, the the j & k shortcut keys behave as expected.  The observations appear to be browser agnostic, i.e. I can replicate the observations on Firefox, Chrome, and IE.  Can you investigate and let me know if you can replicate the problem?
fields.summary: Tempo 7.6.0.1 impairs keyboard shortcut functionality in issue navigator

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33214].
  {panel}

The documentation on [How to disable or enable the GOT FEEDBACK button|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/How+to+disable+or+enable+the+GOT+FEEDBACK+button] looks outdated, and it is not possible to remove the GOT FEEDBACK button by following this documentation.

Tested this on OnDemand and on a JIRA 6.0 Standalone, it doesn't work on them. It works for JIRA 5.2.11 Standalone.

What is the correct way to remove the button?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Remove the GOT FEEDBACK button documentation is incorrect
Componenet level Security

fields.description:
After migrating from Jira 4.4.5 to Jira 5.2.5, I'm not able anymore to import custom field values to Jira using the CSV import tool.

I'm talking about a custom field whose type I've built myself using a Jira plugin. During stage 3 of the CSV import tool, where I'm supposed to match a CSV column to a Jira field ; my field doesn't appear among all importable fields.

Is it a known problem? A known limitation?

FYI, in my point of view, my field has been properly migrated to the new custom field type hierarchy. It works properly, except for CSV import.

Thx for your help

Some other stuck developers:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/40882/cannot-use-custom-fields-for-importing-from-external-system
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/156771/how-to-import-issues-into-jira-from-csv-with-custom-fields-of-nfeed
fields.summary: CSV import tool mapping ignores my customfield

fields.description:
Wiki Markup Fails to Render Bullet Point after a New Line is being inserted

Example:
{noformat} * line 1 \\ * line 2 \\ * line 3 {noformat}

Expected Result:
* line 1
* line 2
* line 3

Returned Result
* line 1 \\* line 2 \\* line 3

*Additional Information*
* Tested also using the following, but expected result not obtained
{noformat}
* line 1 \\* line 2 \\* line 3
* line 1 * line 2 * line 3
{noformat}

*Use Case*
Actual Quote from Customer:
{quote}Since Fisheye smart commit comments do not allow carriage returns, we have to use a the newline text effect.{quote}
fields.summary: Wiki Markup Fails to Render Bullet Point after New Line
Store the order of the All tab in the issue screen

fields.description:
Hello,
I just installed yesterday Jira 6.0 x32 on a Windows Server 2008 R2. Installation and setup worked like a charm but when I log in to Jira the system dashboard does not rendre properly.
I tried with Internet Explorer 8 & 10 - both with the same result. Before I had Jira 5.x on the test server and that worked fine.
Hope you can help.
Cheers & thx,
Andreas

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33206].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA logs shows very general trace when it can't connect to Bamboo or when JIRA does not retrieve data from Bamboo correctly.

But, there are traces in Bamboo indicating the real root cause. 

So, having a more descriptive logging in JIRA will help in troubleshooting JIRA-Bamboo integration problem.

It's even better if the trace shows the REST request fire by JIRA that is throwing ERROR (as JIRA FishEye Plugin did).
fields.summary: Better Logging for JIRA and Bamboo Integration
"Last commented by a User Flag" should be configurable and part of JIRA core

fields.description:
*Reproducible*

* Login to Jira 6
* From top menu click:
** Issues > Issues For Calendar (arbitrary) > Toggle Detail View
* Page Loader icon displays (image attached)
* First issue from list does not appear
* Clicking on any issue on the left pane, does the same

*Investigations*
* Error log does not show anything peculiar
* When clicking on various issues on the left pane, ajax requests execute and complete in a timely manner
* I notice they toggle between and POST and GET requests. Not sure if this has any bearing on the problem or not
* On jira.atlassian i notice the following ajax requests:
** [POST] https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/issueNav/1/issueTable; followed by
** [POST] https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueAction!default.jspa
* On our local install:
** [GET] http://jira.our.domain/secure/IssueAction!default.jspa
** [GET] http://jira.our.domain/secure/EditAction!default.jspa

*Tested on*:

* Windows8/Firefox v21.0
* Windows8/Opera v12.15
* Windows8/Chromium v26.0
* Linux/Firefox v21.0
* Mac/Google Chrome v27.0
* Mac/Firefox v21.0
fields.summary: Detail View stuck in "Page Loading" state when in Issues List page

fields.description:
It appears that with the latest JIRA release some changes were made to the Feedback form which causes it to hide the e-mail field in Chrome. 

If I put a Chrome window side-by-side with Firefox I can see that the Feedback form is much taller in Firefox (approximately 542 pixels) compared to Chrome (approximately 452 pixels).

Side by side screenshot attached for reference. 

All of my customers use Chrome, so this is a big problem for me. I'm sure a lot of others will be impacted as well. Please let me know how soon this can be fixed.
fields.summary: Feedback form in Chrome does not display correctly

fields.description:
There is a bug in the com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.PluginHttpRequestWrapper class when the paths of the dispatcher and the forwaded servlets are compared.
This avoids to use servlet forwading from plug-ins.

Please, see the JRA-33155 to get the details.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33195].
  {panel}

In the "Projects" dropdown in the top navigation bar in Jira, each project name is followed by the project's key in parenthesis, eg:
* Jira (JRA)
* Confluence (CONF)
* Crowd (CWD)

On the Create Issue screen, the "Project" field dropdown list shows only the project names. Could this field include the key, just as the "Projects" navigation menu does? Could this be an option that could be enabled/disabled? Could it also be an option to display the key either before or after the name?

Thanks,
Andrew
fields.summary: Add project keys to project dropdown on create issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33189].
  {panel}

The issue navigator's JQL will add up the *order by* sorting rather replaced the last *order by* sorting. To understand this further, please refer to the video in the attachment.

*Steps to Replicate*
# Sort by click on the column key on issue navigator
# Sort by click on the column issuetype 
# Sort by click on the column summary 
# Switch to Advance searching an noticed the below query is created
{noformat}ORDER BY summary ASC, issuetype DESC, key ASC{noformat}

Expected to only order by summary which is the last sorting requested.

*Additional Information*
* Tested on JIRA 6 and 5.2.11 having similar issue
* Browser variant are all affected
fields.summary: Issue Navigator Multiple Order By

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33188].

Currently we only have documented the 'Migrate users from one directory to another' feature in a KB article
* [Migrating users from one directory to another|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Migrating+users+from+one+directory+to+another]

Every JIRA feature should be added to the JIRA documentation page. 
I believe the best place to have this information would be inside [User and Group Management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/User+and+Group+Management]
fields.summary: Add "Migrate users from one directory to another" documentation

fields.description:
h4. Summary
In JIRA 6.0, renaming a username is not possible when JIRA is used for User Management. However, there is a method for changing username; which is to disable the JIRA server temporarily, change the username, and then turn   it on again. 

This creates a problem with 2 conditions:
# Without Incremental Synchronization, a new user will be created, rather than renaming the username. 
!no-ex-sync.png!
# With Incremental Synchronization, no new user is created. But the pages that are created using the previous username will be changed to Anonymous.
!anonymous.png!
fields.summary: Renaming username in JIRA will break the application it links to

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33182].
  {panel}

Post Functions placed after the "Creates the issue originally." event will not persist in the database and this is not clarified or restricted within JIRA.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Copy the default JIRA workflow
# Add the "Update Issue Field" post function to the "Create Issue" transition
# Set the function to update any field (Description, Assignee, etc.) to a specific value
# Create the issue

h3. Expected results
The issue is created with the assignee/description/whatever specified in the post function.

h3. Actual results
The issue is created without the change that's specified in the post function.

I can replicate this on a fresh install of JIRA 6.0, as well as 6.0-OD-12 and -13.

h3. Workaround:
* [The 'Update Issue Field' Post-Function Doesn't work when Creating Issues after Upgrading to JIRA 6|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/The+%27Update+Issue+Field%27+Post-Function+Doesn%27t+work+when+Creating+Issues+after+Upgrading+to+JIRA+6] knowledge base article.
* [Post-function on Create Issue transition appears to not work|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Post-function+on+Create+Issue+transition+appears+to+not+work]
fields.summary: Update Issue Field post function doesn't fire when set for Create Issue transition

fields.description:
h3.Symptoms
* Directory sync fails with errors such as this:
{code}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: can't parse argument number: 5c2d3f31-249f-4455-b1fb-8f190de41a9c
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at java.text.MessageFormat.makeFormat(MessageFormat.java:1420)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at java.text.MessageFormat.applyPattern(MessageFormat.java:479)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at java.text.MessageFormat.<init>(MessageFormat.java:363)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at java.text.MessageFormat.format(MessageFormat.java:835)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at com.atlassian.crowd.util.TimedOperation.complete(TimedOperation.java:18)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DirectoryCacheImplUsingChangeOperations.syncUserMembersForGroup(DirectoryCacheImplUsingChangeOperations.java:124)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseMemberships(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:145)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:84)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.UsnChangedCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(UsnChangedCacheRefresher.java:124)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.synchroniseCache(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:644)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectorySynchroniserImpl.synchronise(DirectorySynchroniserImpl.java:63)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller.pollChanges(DbCachingDirectoryPoller.java:50)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.monitor.poller.DirectoryPollerJob.execute(DirectoryPollerJob.java:34)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:195)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:520)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | Caused by: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "5c2d3f31-249f-4455-b1fb-8f190de41a9c"
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:65)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:492)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:527)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	at java.text.MessageFormat.makeFormat(MessageFormat.java:1418)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2013/05/21 12:52:32 | 	... 14 more
{code}


h3.Cause
JIRA (Embedded CWD) parses the curly braces as a numerical argument. 

h3.Observation
* If the groupname instead, is this: usergroup {2}, the error will not be thrown
* Only happens in JIRA 6.0. 5.2 and below is *not affected*

h3.Workaround
Change the Group/User Object Filter to something like this (to filter out groups/users containing the curly braces):
{code:title=Group Filter}
(&(objectCategory=Group)(!(cn=*{*}*)))
{code}
{code:title=User Filter}
(&(objectCategory=Person)(!(sAMAccountName=*{*}*)))
{code}
The example above applies for Active Directory with the username attribute set to {{sAMAccountName}} and groupname attribute set to {{cn}}. These are the default settings.

(!) This will prevent users and groups being added to JIRA that contain curley braces. This can potentially delete groups and users from the instance.
fields.summary: Upgrade to Embedded Crowd 2.6.2 or later - Directory Sync Fails if there are Users or Groups with Curly Braces in their User/Groupname (can't parse argument number error)

fields.description:
I've created two servlets: hello, which displays "Hello", and world, which displays "World". They work fine when invoked:

http://localhost:2990/jira/plugins/servlet/hello 

displays "Hello" and 

http://localhost:2990/jira/plugins/servlet/world

displays "World"

Now, I want to forward the hello to the world servlet when a forward parameter is set to "true":

http://localhost:2990/jira/plugins/servlet/hello?forward=true

Then, JIRA says /jira/plugins/servlet/world not found!!!

Even worst, if the url-pattern of the hello servlet (/hello) is changed to a string with more than 5 characters (the length of world) then an exception is raised.
fields.summary: Servlet forwarding does not work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33148].
  {panel}

User permission should be linked between the JIRA , Confluence and Stash once they establish an application link. 

Prerequisites:
a. Project in JIRA, in Stash and Confluence.
b. Those projects are linked to each other
c. Main user database is in the JIRA.

Scenario 1: New developer is added to the project
Now:
1. Project manager adds this user to the project team with particular role
2. Project manager goes to the Confluence and adds this user to appropriate space with appropriate rigths
3. Project manager goes to stash and adds user there 
Should be:
1. Project manager adds user to the project with appropriate role
2. User granted rights to confluence project and stash project according to his role.

This can be implemented through capability to assign access rights in Confluence to the particular role of particular project. (Or even globally). 
Second alternative - maintain "shadow" groups in jira, that will correspond to each role in each project. This way on the stage of project start we will be able to assign confluence rights for each of those groups.

Scenario 2: User leaves the project
Now:
1. Project manager removes this user from the project
2. He should also remember to remove this user from the all other places (Confluence, stash, etc)

Should be:
1. Project manager removes this user from the project
2. All the access rights are updated automatically.
fields.summary: Automatically propagate permissions from JIRA to Confluence and Stash

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33147].
  {panel}

The JIRA issue collector has an API for sending custom data and hidden form fields from javascript. Unfortunately all of this data is set at load time and can't be altered. This is a problem for highly dynamic pages which where API users may want to submit the state of the page at the time a user clicks a collector trigger.

The specific use case for Confluence is that the editor content changes as the user types. Then when they hit a problem and hit got feedback we'd like to be able to tell what the state of the editor is.

Another use case is single page applications which want to load the issue collector just once but have it submit feedback as if the user were navigating around, submitting the state of the page that the user has progressed to.

Note: I'm creating this ticket so that I can mark it as done when I commit this code sitting in front of me.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA issue collector custom triggers to submit custom data after page load.

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33145].
  {panel}

Often I create an issue and then want to perform an immediate operation on it

Since JIRA moved to the "this issue was created and here is a link" style of post issue creation its not easy to do this.

I think we should add an issue operation cog / capability so that one can click on the "message box" and then get a series of operations just like in an issue nav list or on the issue itself.

This should be accessible by other plugins as well on all issue links I think.

For example once I have created and issue I would like to assign it or add it to a spring or generally transition it and so on.  I can do this if I follow the link (and wait for page load) but I have an issue in context here so why cant I work on it.
fields.summary: Have issue operations available on newly crated issue links

Currently the bulk watch feature only the current login user to bulk watch the list of issues he/she wants. However, sometimes a project lead may need his group to bulk watch some important issues. Instead of asking the user to do themselves, the project lead should have the ability to bulk watch the issues using groups or roles.

h5. Suggestion:
* Add the option during Bulk Watch operation to allow user to input a specific user, group or roles.
* A great power comes with great responsibility. This feature should only restricted to user with Administer Project permission in permission scheme.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33133].
  {panel}

The current workflow import process in JIRA 6.0 doesn't notify user if it requires additional plugin, but only after import and remove those items such as post function, validation, condition, and etc. 

It would be best if the workflow importer checks the external plugin requirement before the user imports a workflow.  This way, the user can import the required plugin beforehand and use 100% feature from the workflow imported.

Below is the test that I did to verify the current workflow importing process.

h3. Testing Description
* Testing the workflow exporting process (.jwb workflow bundle file) in JIRA 6 that is customized with an external workflow third-party party (Ie. JIRA Suite Utilities with custom workflow post-function and validation).

h3. Testing Specification
* JIRA 6 RC1 installed with third-party plugin: JIRA Suite Utilities
* JIRA 6 RC1 Vanilla Instance with no plugin installed

h3. What I did
# Customize workflow in JIRA 6 RC1 installed with third-party plugin: JIRA Suite Utilities with their own post-function and condition
# Export it as workflow then it would basically generate the (.jwb) file 
# Install a fresh JIRA 6 RC1 Vanilla Instance
# Import the workflow (.jwb) file into it

h3. Outcome
It is successfully being imported. However it only notify us about the additional plugin and configuration information like the following:
!workflow_successfully_imported.jpg!
Basically if I need to use the exact same workflow again. I have to delete this workflow, install the plugin and reimport again. This could be a big hassle.

h3. Suggested Improvement
* In the first step after user click to import. Workflow importer should validate / check the workflow selected, 
* If new plugin is required, it should inform the user with information like below:
{quote}
This workflow require the following plugins:
* JIRA Suites Utilities
* JIRA ToolKit

Some features in in workflow will be remove without these plugins. Click cancel to install these plugin or proceed to import the workflow.
{quote}

* We can even integrate Marketplace into this so that the user can directly install these plugins without leaving workflow importer page.
fields.summary: Improvement on workflow importing process in JIRA 6
